meanings.definition: Feel intense or passionate dislike for someone.
meanings.sent1: I hate broccoli because it tastes bad to me.
meanings.sent2: She hates waking up early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: My cat seems to hate wearing the silly hat I got for her.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to hate the clouds, trying to break through them.
meanings.sent5: The little boy's hate for peas was so strong, he refused to eat them.

meanings.definition: Have a strong aversion to something.
meanings.sent1: They hate the sound of nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent2: I hate the smell of fish cooking.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to hate baths, running away when he heard the water.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to hate the new paint color, looking dull and sad.
meanings.sent5: Her hate for spiders was so strong, she couldn't even look at a picture of one.

meanings.sent1: He hates the idea of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent2: She hates the thought of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit seemed to hate the taste of the medicine, spitting it out.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to hate the wind, its branches shaking angrily.
meanings.sent5: Their hate for horror movies was so strong, they covered their eyes during the scary parts.
